utterance_2.transcript: Yeah, it's like regular boggle, but in Klingon.
utterance_2.speaker: Leonard

utterance_7.transcript: I'm a Sagittarius, which probably tells you way more than you need to know.
utterance_7.speaker: Penny

utterance_9.transcript: It tells us that you participate in the mass cultural delusion that the son's apparent position relative to arbitrarily defined constellations at the time of your birth somehow affects your personality.
utterance_9.speaker: Sheldon

utterance_10.transcript: What does it mean in the what?
utterance_10.speaker: Penny

utterance_11.transcript: I think what Sheldon's trying to say is that Sagittarius wouldn't have been our first guess.
utterance_11.speaker: Leonard

utterance_13.transcript: A lot of people think I'm a water sign.
utterance_13.speaker: Penny

utterance_22.transcript: Uh, do you have some sort of a job?
utterance_22.speaker: Leonard

utterance_24.transcript: I'm a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.
utterance_24.speaker: Penny

utterance_28.transcript: I just think it's a good idea.
utterance_28.speaker: Leonard

utterance_29.transcript: Oh, anyways, I'm also writing a screenplay.
utterance_29.speaker: Penny

utterance_30.transcript: It's about this sensitive girl who comes to LA from Lincoln, Nebraska to be an actress and winds up a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory.
utterance_30.speaker: Penny

utterance_31.transcript: So it's based on your life?
utterance_31.speaker: Leonard

utterance_33.transcript: Well, if that was a movie, I would go see it.
utterance_33.speaker: Leonard

utterance_37.transcript: Um, I guess that's about it.
utterance_37.speaker: Penny

utterance_41.transcript: Until I fell in love with a jerk.
utterance_41.speaker: Penny

utterance_42.transcript: God, you know, four years I lived with him.
utterance_42.speaker: Penny

utterance_44.transcript: That's like as long as high school.
utterance_44.speaker: Penny

utterance_45.transcript: It took you four years to get through high school.
utterance_45.speaker: Sheldon

utterance_46.transcript: I just, I can't believe I trusted him.
utterance_46.speaker: Penny

utterance_48.transcript: I feel like I should say something.
utterance_48.speaker: Leonard

utterance_51.transcript: You want to know the most pathetic part?
utterance_51.speaker: Penny

utterance_52.transcript: Even though I hate his lying, cheating guts.
utterance_52.speaker: Penny
